conclusion: Need to analyze the motion of the particle as described by the acceleration-time graph.
The graph shows the acceleration a as a function of time t.
From t = 0 to t = t0/2, the acceleration is positive and increasing linearly.
From t = t0/2 to t = t0, the acceleration is positive and decreasing linearly.
From t = t0 to t = 3t0/2, the acceleration is negative and increasing linearly.
From t = 3t0/2 to t = 2t0, the acceleration is negative and decreasing linearly.
Velocity can be found by integrating the acceleration with respect to time.
The area under the acceleration-time graph gives the change in velocity.
From t = 0 to t = t0/2, the velocity v is a0 t^2/t0.
From t = t0/2 to t = t0, the velocity v is -a0 t0/4.
From t = t0 to t = 3t0/2, the velocity v is -a0 t0/4.
From t = 3t0/2 to t = 2t0, the velocity v is 3a0 t0/4.
Position can be found by integrating the velocity with respect to time.
From t = 0 to t = t0/2, the position x is a0 t0^2/24.
From t = t0/2 to t = t0, the position x is -a0 t0^2/8.
From t = t0 to t = 3t0/2, the position x is -a0 t0^2/8.
